title: Home Of Franklin D Roosevelt National Historic Site: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Curriculum Materials Education programs, whether presented in the historic structures or on the grounds of the Home of FDR, Val-Kill, Vanderbilt Mansion, or back in the classroom, cultivate an understanding of the significance of our national historic sites and promote stewardship of these special places.  All Curriculum Materials     Field Trips For information about National Park Service programs call Susanne Norris at 845-229-6873. To schedule a school group for the Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt or the Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library & Museum, call Kevin Thomas at 845-486-7751.  All Field Trips     Institutes & Field Schools Teaching The Hudson Valley helps educators and others interested in the region's culture, environment, and history to explore places and discover the world. All Institutes & Field Schools   Teaching the Hudson Valley 2013 Summer Institute    Common Core & Place Based Learning Learn More
